clinical_study.brief_title: Enhanced Metal Reduction Techniques for Definitive CT Scanning to Assess Spinal Fusion With TM-Ardis
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Enhanced Metal Reduction Techniques for Definitive CT Scanning to Assess Spinal Fusion With Trabecular Metal Implants (TM-Ardis)

brief_summary.textblock: To determine if the subject metal reduction software helps to better visualize bone interphase and fusion reliability. Assess whether the appropriate procedural modification facilitates clearer images when implanted with a trabecular metal spinal implant

detailed_description.textblock: To determine if the subject metal reduction software helps to better visualize bone interphase and fusion reliability, and assess whether the appropriate procedural modification facilitates clearer images when implanted with a trabecular metal spinal implant.

primary_outcome.measure: CT scan to determine if the study software can reduce metal scatter on the scan.
primary_outcome.description: Each CT scan will be evaluated to asses if you can visualize fusion, bone interface, and/or device migration with an experimental metal reduction software for CT scan

arm_group.description: Patients who are receiving a TM-Ardis implant for degenerative disc disease will have a CT scan immediate post op (2 weeks) and again at 6 months to determine if fusion can be assessed with the study metal reduction software. Will utilize TM- Ardis implant and Metal Reduction CT software

intervention.intervention_name: TM- Ardis implant and Metal Reduction CT software
intervention.description: TM- Ardis implant and Metal Reduction CT software

study_pop.textblock: All patients who are having a spinal fusion procedure with TM-Ardis and meet the requirements below are eligible for this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A signed informed consent.
- Male or non-pregnant female scheduled for Trabecular Metal (TM - Ardis) implant, single level lumbar.
- Participant must be at least 18 years of age.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is pregnant Patient is unable to comprehend the requirements of the study.
- Patient is unable to undergo scanning (due to body habitus, inability to comply with positioning requirements, etc.).
